column1: Absence of thirst may be due to: - Birth defects of the brain - Bronchial tumor that causes syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion (SIADH) - Hydrocephalus - Injury or tumor of part of the brain called the hypothalamus - Stroke
The health care provider will take a medical history and perform a physical exam.
- Do you have other symptoms such as abdominal pain, headaches, or swallowing problems?
